1.content:
Lisa tried not to fidget in the waiting room of The Nexus while other people were checking in. She'd gotten the call a few hours ago that someone had selected her, and would be renting her life, but there had been no other information with the phone call. Those things, they had said, would be discussed when she arrived. Scanning the lobby, she wondered if any of the people checking in were clients, and if one of them was a client she'd be renting her life to.

The first person she spotted was an older gentleman, somewhere around her father's age, or maybe a little younger. He wore a business suit in a way that proclaimed his importance to the world. Everything about him said 'money,' from the well tailored fit of his suit to the expensive Rolex watch on his wrist. His once dark hair showed the signs of fading to a steely gray, but he wore it in a way that said 'distinguished' far more than it said 'old.'

Next to the older man, a younger career woman in her late twenties or early thirties stood, working her way through the mountain of paperwork with methodical precision. She had clearly come straight from work, and her simple skirt hugged her thick thighs and full rear end in a way that managed to be sexy while still being professional. Her blouse showed a hint of impressive cleavage, but not nearly enough to invite comments about dress code.

Several other people bustled around the reception counter at the far end, at least one of whom appeared to be a mother, trying desperately to reign in her three children while processing paperwork. Also at the far end, a woman who's every inch shouted: Stripper. From the platform heel shoes, to the micro mini skirt and the overly large fake breasts, very little about the woman was not on display. Lisa wondered if she was here as a client, or to rent out her own life.

Further musing was interrupted however when a side door opened and a young woman dressed in scrubs called: "Lisa, we're ready for you to come back."

"Just follow me, Lisa," the woman in scrubs said. "My name is Tina, and I'll be administering your transition today. I understand this is your first time?"

"Yes," Lisa said, a little nervous as she followed the woman back into the complex. She hadn't known what to expect, but once she got over the jitters, she couldn't help but feel that it was a little disappointing. The hallways felt more like the back area of a clinic than a strange or mystic realm that would transform her life. "The brochure said that the process was painless, but that it could be disorienting...."

"Both are absolutely true," Tina said, stopping at a door. "It's really difficult to explain until you've gone through it once, but I have done it myself and I assure you it's really quite painless. I'm going to let you into the room here, and once you get in, if you would change out of your clothes and into the gown provided, we'll get things under way. Just take a seat on the stool, we'll worry about the fancy chair once you've changed. I'll be taking your clothes and your purse once you're out of them, and handing those to the person who's taking your life. Once we're finished, I'll bring their items to you so that you can get dressed. After that, we'll go over the specifics of the person who's life you'll be living while they rent yours, and give you a little time to settle into it before you leave. Any questions?"

"Oh, so I don't get to find out about the person who's renting my life until after it's done?" Lisa asked.

"No, I'll be perfectly honest, we've found that it creates problems. We had too many people back out when they found that the life they would be living wasn't appealing to them. In general, our clients lead nice lives, and can afford our services, but they all have reasons to want to be someone else for a little while. We've found that by setting your requirements for rental rate, and availability, in advance, we're able to find a client who can meet those requirements and execute the agreement. After all, they are the client, if you wanted to vacation in someone else's life of your choosing, then you would be the client."

"I guess that makes sense," Lisa said, stepping into the room. Despite what Tina had said, she found it hard to not look at the futuristic couch in the center of the room, or at the circle of strange and arcane symbols that were carved into the tile floor around the chair.

Minutes after getting dressed in the simple white hospital gown, Tina took her clothing away and helped her into the softly padded couch. A clear shield was lowered in place over her eyes and lights began to dance across her face as Tina began to work her magic. A strange pulling sensation enveloped Lisa from the bottom of her toes to the top of her head, and the flashing lights before her eyes began to blur together as magic pulled her identity from her. Moments later, she drifted into a deep sleep while a new identity was laid over her body, and skills were downloaded from the client and mapped into her own brain.

When Lisa woke, it was with a different identity, but who's?

She did, however, stop when she picked up the bra, finding it to be substantially different in design from the light bras she was used to wearing. "36DDD?" Lisa read off the label. "Um, this won't fit me, I'm no where near that big!"

"Just slip it on dear, you'll find it fits just as well as the panties did. And believe me, even though you aren't that big, if you try going bra-less, not only will you feel the effects, but you'll feel them as though you were that big. And trust me, there's a reason that women as busty as Angela, or should I say, as busty as you, don't go without support!"

Fumbling for a moment with the extra hooks in the bra, she quickly found the support more welcome than she had expected. Tina hadn't been kidding that things would affect her strangely while living Angela's life. More fumbling followed as she slid into the other woman's thigh high stockings and garter belt, before pulling on her size 8 skirt and struggling into the blouse that hugged her chest like no other shirt ever had. "So, I guess getting dressed isn't one of the things that comes with the 'skills' I get from her, is it?"

"No, I'm sorry Angela," Tina said, already starting to call Lisa by the name that went with her current identity. "But, Monday morning when you get to work, you'll find all the knowledge that goes with an undergraduate degree in accounting and masters in business administration is tucked away within your head."

"Oh, wow, that sounds important," Lisa said, digging through her new purse to find an impressive collection of credit cards, business cards, and other nick knacks within. "I had thought she was a secretary, or something."

"Oh heaven's no, I doubt many secretaries would be able to afford to rent your life for an entire month," Tina said, collecting a folder of information about Angela's life for Lisa.

"A whole month?" Lisa asked, a little surprised. "I only put down for ten weeks that I'm available, and she paid for almost half of it?"

"She did. She said that she'd skipped summer vacation after her senior year to get ready for school in the fall, and she missed her senior class trip. She was very insistent in booking this that she be able to go on your senior class trip, since she missed hers ten years ago. Now, if you don't have any other questions, I'll go ahead and walk you out."
112.title: Angela Stein, the career woman from the lobby

choices: Read the note from Angela before going anywhere
Head straight to Angela's home, further reading can wait
Home can wait, it's Friday night and she has full adult freedoms to enjoy!
1121.content:
Walking out of The Nexus was the first of what Lisa felt would be many strange sensations over the next few weeks. Her heals clicked rhythmically on the tile floor as she walked through the lobby, drawing eyes that simply responded to the sound. Once most people in the lobby saw her, they looked away, back to whatever magazines they were reading or their smart phones. Male eyes, however, she noticed lingered longer, particularly on her bust and hips. It was a strange feeling, but one she found herself almost enjoying.

Stepping into the bright evening sun of the parking lot, she began to fumble in her purse for a pair of sunglasses before realizing that the lenses of the prescription glasses she wore were adjusting to the light. Walking out into the parking lot, she clicked the button on her car keys and followed the 'chirp' until she found herself at a recent model Lexus, neatly maintained and freshly washed.

"Wow," she said, sliding into the soft leather interior. "They weren't kidding about the kind of people who could afford this kind of vacation."

Taking a moment to sit in the car's air conditioned interior, Lisa flipped through the folder of information, looking for the most important bits.... address, immediate schedule, relationships. There, perhaps, the file was a little sad. Significant Other: None. Best Friend: Hanna Dawson, Other Friends: None. Was Angela really this lonely? There were pictures of co-workers, lists of things that were coming up at work in the next month, but Lisa skipped over that, looking only for things that would be relevant for the weekend. She could study up for Monday later.

Hobbies: Wine collecting, reading, yoga, and photography. Well, none of those sounded too boring, and the wine part would be fun, especially since Lisa wouldn't be old enough to buy her own alcohol for another three years! She also found her home address, a nice, upscale condo on the tenth floor of a thirty story building, on the west waterfront.

Oh, and it looked like Angela had left her a personal note as well....
1121.title: Continue with Lisa as she heads to Angela's...

choices: Head to Angela's home and see where Lisa will be living for the next month
11211.content:
A note from the person renting her life felt a little strange. No one had mentioned doing so, and she assumed that the packet she got from Angela would include much the same information she had left in the packet that was to be given to Angela. What was odd, more than just the presence of the note, was that it was addressed to her as 'Lisa'. Figuring that anything important enough to leave her a personal note should be read sooner than later, Lisa unfolded it and began to read.

Lisa,

By the time you read this, you will be closer to me than any member of my own family. I realize that this is a business transaction, but I want you to know why I chose your life. I feel that of everyone available, you will be the best choice to live my life while I enjoy yours. You seem like a responsible young woman, and I feel that I will be able to trust you with my job and home while I live your life.

More than that though, I want you to know how precious of a gift I'm receiving. I've been the 'sensible one' for a long time, and by becoming you, I feel I'll have an opportunity to cut loose a bit and have a glimpse of what could have been. For me to have that, you have to give up that priceless opportunity. I think the money that I've paid for the opportunity is hardly enough, after all, the time that we have and the memories that we build are worth more than mere dollars and cents.

So, I have two things I want to give you while you're living my life. The first is very simple: I want you to know that I have budgeted an extra $10,000 in 'fun' that is reserved for your use. I would have used the money to rent more time in your life, but I feel like you should be able to enjoy some of the finer things in life while I rob you of your summer vacation. Visit a spa, go shopping, take a weekend trip, or do something that just interests you. I understand that with my job to work around, it's not a full time vacation, but I hope you make good use of the money and the time left to yourself.

The second thing I want to give you is a request, but one I hope you will enjoy. I'm not very outgoing... and as you can see from the file, I have few friends. I haven't had a boyfriend since my sophomore year in college. I'd like to ask you to date while you're living my life. You don't have to, I understand if you don't. And you don't have to worry about 'finding me a man,' that I can continue to date once things are done, but if you do, I would count it a huge blessing.

Per the terms of the rental agreement, we won't be allowed to communicate during the rental, but I do have the wild fantasy that we may see each other again after the month is up, and I hope that we can be friends then.

Angela


Folding up the letter, Lisa spent a few minutes lost in thought before she was able to get herself moving. She'd tried to think of this as just a different way of having a summer job, but hadn't given much thought to how it would impact her own life.... or how much impact she could have on Amanda's. The letter; however, made her feel very much like she had made the right decision. Perhaps the summer could give them both something they needed. And pleasant surprises to come home to for both of them!
11211.title: Read the note from Angela before going anywhere

choices: Skip to the next day as she begins her weekend as Angela
112111.content:
The drive back to Angela's apartment was both quick, and amazingly comfortable. The summer heat had rolled in last week and showed no signs of fading. While Lisa's own car was sufficient to the task of getting her to and from school and sporting events, it was woefully inadequate in the luxury realms of comfortable seats and air conditioning. Driving in heals was less awkward than she feared, but the combination of the shoes and the smooth acceleration left her far closer to getting a ticket than she wanted, and she was sure that it was the last thing Angela would want to come home to.

The apartment itself struck Lisa as small, especially compared to her parent's sprawling two story suburban home, but every inch of it was well furnished in tasteful luxury. Her heels clicked on the polished hardwood as she explored the apartment, taking in the small, well appointed kitchen with a floor to ceiling wine closet. When Angela had listed wine collecting as among her hobbies, she hadn't been kidding. Outside of the kitchen was a small formal eating area, with a table that would comfortably seat 2-3, though she had chairs for 4, and beyond that, a spacious living room with full height windows showing a commanding view of the sun setting over the river.

"Wow," she said, walking out onto the high rise apartment's balcony and reveling in the cool breeze coming off the water. "I could get used to this pretty quick."

Wandering back in side, she found a small office, with computer desk and laptop, and several book shelves, lined with everything from murder mystery to cheap romance. In one corner of the office, a comfortable reading chair sat next to a small table that already held a wine glass and half finished bottle. A copy of a new hard cover mystery lay on the table next to the wine, a bookmark proclaiming that Angela had been half way through the book when she started this vacation. "That has to suck," Lisa said, picking up the book. "She won't find out who did it till she gets back from vacation. Unless she blows my allowance on a copy of her own I guess."

Between the office and the bedroom, she found another luxury feature of the apartment: the bathroom. And calling it a bathroom seemed a bit like a joke, personal spa felt more like it. The room had a glass shower with 3 separate shower heads, and that was in addition to the massive jetted tub that filled a corner of the room. The opulent features of the room could only distract her for moments though, because for the first time since The Nexus worked their magic, she got a good look at herself in the mirror, and the sight took her breath away.

No one had talked about mirrors when explaining the process, and she hadn't given them much thought until seeing herself reflected. Her eyes flicked down to look at her body, if only to confirm that it was still as she expected it to be, unchanged by the process, before returning to the vision in the mirror. The woman in the mirror looked like Lisa, there was no mistaking that. She hadn't taken on Angela's face or complete outward appearance. But she had taken on many of Angela's attributes in the reflection. She looked older, closer to entering her thirties than entering her twenties. More than that, her figure was remarkably different, displaying the valley of cleavage that the 36DDD bra she wore was designed to not only support, but uplift.

Unbuttoning her blouse, Lisa ran her fingers over her torso, taking in the soft, yielding flesh and the pale complexion, along with the immaculate manicure on her nails. By no means was she anything that she would call 'fat,' but she certainly had more flesh rounding out her figure and curves. She shimmied out of the skirt next, standing to examine her reflection in nothing but her stockings and underwear, and she had to admit that what she saw impressed her. She was no model, but she was undeniably pretty, if in a plain but curvy kind of way.

"Wow, so that's how everyone sees me right now. This is unreal.... and so, so cool!"
112111.title: Head to Angela's home and see where Lisa wi...

1121111.content:
"This is a good life." Lisa said to herself. She was lying with her head against the wall inside the jetted tub. The bubbles were going at a steady rate, on a tile next to her was a fine glass of wine and next to it the murder mystery novel Angela was reading. Lisa's first thoughts were to read something more her style, but then she thought that this was Angela's life so she should get used to Angela's things.

After finishing examining her "altered" body, Lisa decided to change into something more comfortable. Luckily she found a pair of sweatpants with a hoodie which wasn't used that often. She felt a bit like her old self dressed like that.

After putting the old clothes in the laundry bin, her tummy rumbled a bit. Lisa was a bit curious about what to cook for herself. Luckily she had helped her mom enough times with dinner to know how to cook. When looking in the refrigerator Lisa noticed the health snacks she kept . "Wonder why she would want to do that? She's got a good enough figure." She mumbled as she found the ingredient for pasta to make. She quickly finished up making the meal and then began to eat. She noticed that while eating she was eating perfectly with fork and knife.
But while eating she looked around herself. The only things around her were the four empty chairs. She suddenly missed home, back home when during dinner the whole family was talking with each other. Suddenly having this quiet mood around, was something she was not used to. No wonder Angela wanted to take her life. "Well I'm going to change that." She promised herself.

After putting the dishes inside the dishwasher Lisa checked out the laptop. She found a sticky note giving the password and that she should tear this note up after reading it. On the laptop wasn't anything special, most was about work-related stuff. Things she should go through tomorrow. Turning the laptop off, she suddenly yawned. This happened to be a long day, a good night sleep was just what she needed. After spending some time in the tub of course.

And here she was sitting now comfortable in her own tub. This would be one of the perks of this life. Lisa grabbed the glass with wine and made out a toast: "To Angela, and that she may enjoy my life to the fullest extent." She took a sip of the wine and continued with the novel.

When Lisa woke up the next day she was wondering for a few seconds where she was. The bedroom was much larger than normal and her bed much more softer and why was everything blurry? The swapping of lives with Angela, the hot tub she relaxed in and drinking too much wine. "That's much better." She said to herself. She looked at the alarm clock, it was only eight. Normally she would sleep until 10 but this wasn't exactly her life. So she decided to get out of bed. She first took a quick shower, when she dried herself off she had to take another look in the mirror. It was weird seeing herself in the mirror but also not. When she put her hands underneath her breasts they looked the same but felt much bigger. A little brush of her nipples showed her she wasn't that turned on anymore. Tom loved to play with them. Lisa wondered how Angela would deal with him. Well she shouldn't worry about her, she was a grownup after all.

Lisa was disappointed when she looked in Angela's wardrobe, she was going through it a bit fast yesterday but Angela didn't really have much clothes except for skirts and blouses. Perhaps she should make it a shopping day today. Wanting to get used to getting dressed she decided to wear a white blouse with a gray skirt complete with stockings. Looking in the mirror Lisa had to admit it did look good on her, perhaps that's was one of the reasons Angela wore the combination often.

She then began to make breakfast, noticing a kiwi lying in the fridge. She managed to cut it in half and spooned it out. It didn't taste that bad as she thought. At last Lisa was ready for her day, but the problem was what she should do today? She could go to the mall, spend some of the money Angela had given her. Or she could study the documents Angela had given her for her work Monday.

Lisa decided to go out and have some fun. Tomorrow it was Sunday and then she could go study the whole day. Lisa packed Angela's purse and locked the apartment door behind her as she could think of the fun she would have.

At the end of the day Lisa had memorized all of her meetings, co-workers and clients. She was completely tired, Lisa puts off her glasses as she rubbed her eyes. Memorizing things was different than before, not that she would forget stuff but more that she had to study harder to remember things. Like her brain was full and she had to pack every detail of information inside some far away corner of her brain.

Besides that Steven didn't call or text her back the whole day. She was a bit worried about it. Was it that kiss that did it? Was it too soon? Lisa liked Steven, though she wasn't sure what to think about it. After all Lisa and Angela would go back to their own lives in a month. Would Angela like Steven as much as she did now?
To shake off the anxious feelings Lisa grabbed a wine bottle and a glass. She poured the wine in her glass and held it in front of her nose. She smelled the sweet scent of the wine as it made her more relaxed. She took a little sip, it was good quality.

Weird isn't it? I mean I never had a sip of wine in my life before and now I suddenly know what a good wine tastes like.
Lisa took another sip as she looked outside the window. It was a nice view, seeing the river with the moon in the back. It made her calm. Lisa suddenly stood up and opened the door leading to the balcony. She let her arms hang on the railing as she felt the soft summer breeze in her face. She let her thoughts go free, not thinking about being Angela, Steven or any of those things. For a few minutes she felt she was Lisa Hale again.

Lisa then let out a sigh and brushed her hair away from her face as she went inside the apartment again. Tomorrow was a big day.

11211112112121111121.content:
"Angela, can you check these numbers for me? I need them by the end of the day." Harold, Angela's boss, asked Lisa as he laid a handful of papers on her desk.

"No problem." Lisa said as she smiled at Harold. Harold raised an eyebrow as he left her office. What was up with Angela today? Not only did she smile at him constantly, she didn't even complain once in his presence. It was like she was a whole different person.

"Wow, you're in a happy mood." Jill entered Lisa's office with a cup of coffee in her hand. From the files Lisa found out that Jill as a colleague was like a friend to Angela here.

"Oh nothing special, just had a great weekend." Lisa said as she crunched some numbers.

"I can see that. What happened?" Jill asked taking a sip of her coffee.

"Oh nothing special, had an awesome date."

When Jill heard that she choked on her coffee. "On a date serious? Wow, Ang, I never expected that of you. You say you're always too busy with work to do things like that."

"I know, but I came across this great guy and we went out."

"Ooh, details please."

"Well he first took me out dinner and then we went to see a movie. Not one of those action movies, but a drama. It was so sad, but Steven was there to take care of me."

"That's great to hear Ang, finally you're getting on that dating horse." Jill seemed to want to talk more, but then she noticed Harold making his round again. Jill nodded towards him and whispered they would talk later.

Lisa didn't know working could be this much fun. She was on time today, saw the guy named Eric in the lift, made some talk and he didn't suspect a thing.

And this work was fun too, Lisa was first a little scared about doing such an important job but when she sat behind the computer she suddenly knew how things worked. It was like her mind was switched to automatic, she didn't have to think about something to remember it, it just happened.

No way things could go bad.
11211112112121111121.title: Lisa's first day of work.

112111121121211111211.content:
That all changed for Lisa when she had her first meeting of that day. What a drag. She couldn't believe Angela would like this part of her job. They would only talk about things, what clients they had, how to improve staff's performance, how to improve the improvements of the staff's performance.

The only thing that kept Lisa up was the fact that Angela's skills automatically picked up the interesting bits and urged her to respond accordingly. She felt like some sort of robot, only to respond to certain questions.

This was her third and hopefully her last meeting of the day. She was there to discuss an important client. Mr. Johnson, a representative of a huge firm. The details were already set and now Lisa had to reel him in.

Harold her boss was just explaining what Mr. Johnson would expect of Lisa, when Lisa felt her cellphone going off. She had kept it underneath the table in case she was bored. A quick look revealed it was a text message from Stephen. He was asking her how things were. Lisa tried to text him back as quick as she could, but she noticed her text message skill wasn't like she was used to. Things went a lot slower than before.

"Angela!" Lisa looked up to see who it was. "Might I remind you that during meetings we don't look at our cellphones ." Harold was looking at her with such a straight face Lisa felt all happiness disappearing.

"Of course, I was just about to." Lisa apologized. She quickly put her cellphone back in her purse and turned her attention to the meeting. Five minutes passed and as Lisa became bored again, she could hear her cellphone again. Harold was just looking away, she could take a quick peek.

My heart was telling me to make a move but my gut was telling me to walk away, stuff like that I need to get over and hopefully I can do that in a younger person's body.

I really should do something about it to make her time fun inside my body, I will give her $10,000 just to spend on fun things. Spa? Shopping Spree? 1121112.content:
When Lisa woke the next morning, it took her several moments to orient herself in Angela's bedroom. It was strange, not being able to see clearly until she put on Angela's glasses, and the feeling of the soft bed and luxurious bedding made it hard to want to get out of bed. Still, there was a lot that Lisa wanted to do with the weekend before she had to work Angela's job on Monday.

Last night, she had spent quite a bit of time exploring Angela's life, her facebook account, reading her email, and getting to know the space she'd be living in. There had been a few other surprises she'd found that hadn't quite matched up with the profile Angela had left for her. The profile, for example, had listed yoga as a hobby... but while the wine collecting may have been understated, the yoga hobby consisted of a yoga mat tucked into the back of the closet, and a DVD still in its shrink wrap.

Also concerning was the 'best friend' that the profile mentioned: Hannah Dawson. From what Lisa could tell, Hannah and Angela hadn't spoken since near christmas, and the months before that had largely been a series of emails back and forth, planning outings that Angela frequently cancelled or rescheduled for work. If this was the best friendship that she had, it wasn't in good shape.

Niether was Angela's wardrobe in good shape. The closets contained plenty of things to wear to the office, but dreadfully little to wear outside of that, and much of what Angela did have looked like it had been in her wardrobe for a long time. Lisa could certainly understand why Angela wanted this kind of vacation, and now, she was starting to see all the things she could do to help Angela out while she was gone.

So, with all the energy and exuberance of an eighteen year old, Lisa set about the task of making things better, and the first step was...

It was clean enough, new enough, and well located enough to avoid being the kind of dive club that gave discount lap dances between 8 in the morning and 4 in the afternoon with 3rd rate, over the hill girls holding down shifts that no reasonable place would be open for. At the same time, it wasn't posh enough for lines, velvet ropes, a cover charge at the door and more than one VIP lounge. This was a club for the middle and upper middle class. They hadn't chosen this as a life style, and half of them were just party girls getting part time kicks. Most of the white collar Joes wouldn't know the difference anyway.

The sign out front offered $5,000 cash for the top performance, and every dancer got to keep her tips regardless. As armature nights went, it was a pretty hefty purse, but the school year had just ended and that meant any of the dancers who were graduating were likely moving on. This wasn't a contest. It was a recruiting event.

Stepping up to the bouncer at the gate, Lyzette got a much briefer looking over than she was used to before the burly fellow said: "Name?" His tone was bored and he was looking more at the clip board than he was at her.

"Susie Fox," Lyzette said, giving a stage name she'd tossed together on the way over. It wasn't great, but she hadn't had much time to put serious thought into it.

"K, how about your real name," the tough guy said. "And some ID that matches it? Sorry miss, but if you're not legal, you're not getting in no matter how cute that button nose of yours is."

"Oh, um, sorry. It's Lisa, Lisa Hale," Lyzette said, handing over her ID.

After taking her ID, not batting an eye at the age, or difference in appearance between Lyzette's real form and the cute young girl on the drivers license, the burly fellow smiled and pulled a form off his clip board. "All right Lisa, just put Susie Fox on the line where it says 'stage name', but if any of your teachers are in the crowd it's not going to help you much. Take the form inside and give it to Lacy, she's in charge of the girls for the contest. She's easy to spot, red head that's less than five foot nothing and the only one not wearing heels. Contest starts in an hour."

"Okay, thank you...?" Lyzette asked, trailing off and hoping to get a name out of the fellow.

"Mike,' he said, opening the door for her. "Oh, and at the end of the night, exit by this door. Wait for me, I'll walk you to your car."

"Thank you Mike," she said, glad to know that the club valued the safety of it's dancers enough to assign security to walk girls back to their cars. This is warm up hour, but the house is full for the contest so everyone work it. Win or lose, tips are yours with a few exceptions. You aren't being charged for stage time tonight, but the DJ still needs to be tipped, and so does security. That comes out of your tips, but the rest is yours. 113222221112111313.content:
"Oh shit," Kelly Knox whispered from her desk, deep within the Nexus' operational control room.

"Jack... I need you to fetch Director Nail. We've got a class two interference with a client. I'm still looking at the damage, but I put our chance at a successful recovery at less than thirty percent. Probably less than twenty."

"Oh shit," the young intern said, nearly dropping the stack of paperwork he'd been sorting. "Um... what do I tell her?"

Kelly was already tapping keys, new information flashing on her screen as she ran through the commands. "Tell her that Lyzette Diamond ran into a Mad Scientist... maybe a latent Techno Wizard and that she's been through a brain transplant. And on your way to her, get Simon. We're going to need his help to get this sorted."

"Got it," Jack said with a nod before taking off at a run.

At her computer, Kelly started pulling together everything The Nexus could find on Dr. Watts, this... Lacy woman, and what had taken place. They had a good read on Lyzette's body because the enchantments were still bending reality around it, making it appear that she had the body of young, teenaged Lisa. Kelly could see the mild surgical alterations that had been performed, but those alterations were taking significant strain to allow to co-exist with Lyzette's actual body. Essentially, there were two sets of breast implants along with a significant volume of additional tissue, all contained in the same space, and the magical engines of The Nexus were working overtime to maintain that illusion, much less all of the others it was maintaining.

Meanwhile, they had a dimmer read on Lyzette's brain. They could see that it had been placed within another body, and that the body it had been placed in was both older than Lisa's and substantially different. There were traces of magic in that body, and not magic that had come from The Nexus. Likely it had been part of whatever this Dr. Watts had done, whether he realized he was using magic or not. And that was dangerous... really dangerous.

"Okay, talk to me," Director Emma Nail said in a commanding voice as she strode into the control room, heels clicking sharply on the floor. Behind her, a comforting older man in robes walked softly into the room, taking his place against a wall and looking impassively at the data on Kelly's screen.

"Um, Ma'am," Kelly started. "I think... I think someone tried to steel Lisa's body. I think this woman," she said, pulling up Lacy's photo, "got this man," she indicated Dr. Watts, "to perform a quasi-magical brain transplant. I'm looking at the readings... and we're loosing touch with Lyzette's brain very quickly. The body we've got a much better hold on, but it's taking three times the normal energy to hold the reality bends together. And, that's not all," she said, pulling up even more screens. "It's causing strain to maintain Lisa in Lyzette's life. The connection to Lyzette's skills is getting weaker. Within a few days, I don't know if Lisa will be able to keep living Lyzette's life. I mean, we can keep her in the life at that point, but she won't have access to Lyzette's knowledge anymore to live it."

"Well, fuck," Emma said sourly. "Options?"

"Um... we could send a team to capture all three of them... that is, Dr. Watts, Lacy and Lyzette. Bring them back to The Nexus and try to get Dr. Watts to put them back like they were. Or... I guess, if he won't do it... we could have someone take on Dr. Watts life and skills, then do it," she finished. "But if anything goes wrong... people could die. I don't know how risky that brain transplant was. If it can't be reversed... I don't know what we can do. If it was a one time process, we could wind up killing Lyzette and Lacy both, and stranding Lisa in Lyzette's life without her skills."

"That sounds horribly risky," Emma said, pursing her lips. "But if we do it that way, we can put everyone back as they should be in the end, correct?"

"Pretty much. I think that Lisa would have to keep the surgical alterations to her body, but she'd get her body and life back. Lyzette would get her body back and the alterations would be transferred to Lisa. Then we just dump Lacy and Dr. Watts and keep them the hell away from us. Add them to the watch list for clients who might run into them... or figure out a way to hand them over to the authorities. I'm sure they're guilty of other crimes we could expose."

"There is another option," Simon said, coming off the wall at last. "We could smooth out reality."

"What do you mean Simon?" Emma asked.

"We push the bends back to their sources. We force reality to age Lisa's body and to youthen Lyzette's We remove the skills from Lyzette's brain and give them to Lisa. We make the transfer between the two of them a reality. Lyzette will have to live with the consequences of what she did to Lisa's life and we reconcile with Lisa for damages done. She can continue on as a contractor, renting out Lyzette's life if she'd like, or we can see if we can find her another life if someone would like to trade permanently with her."

"Has something like that ever been done?" Kelly asked. "I've never heard of anything like that!"

"It's been done before," Simon said gravely. "Six times."

"I would think that kind of thing would be a very profitable service Simon," Director Nail mused. "Why hasn't the board given us a green light to start selling that?"

"Because," Simon said. "The last time it was done, it scrambled everyone involved. The lead Wizard, Daniel, wound up with the body of an overweight middle age housewife and the life of a womanizing stock broker. He forgot everything he knows about magic but he makes a mean batch of chocolate chip cookies these days... which somehow results in an endless stream of beautiful young women sleeping with him. Most of his magical knowledge wound up with the housewife and the stock broker has been desperately searching for a man to settle down with and raise a family ever since. It was a mess."

"My god," Kelly murmured. "No wonder we haven't tried it since."

"I'd be willing to try it for this," Simon said. "This way, at least Lisa gets a whole life to live, and so does Lyzette. They may not be the lives they wanted, but no one dies."

"But no one gets made whole," Kelly said. "If things work with my plan, we have a chance to make everything right."

"It's your call Emma," Simon said simply. "What do you want to do?"

124.content:
"Her name is Heather Rhodes," the woman in scrubs said. "According to your file, you're good friends with her daughter Megan."

"No way! Megan's mom?" Lisa asked surprised. "Why would she want to rent my life?"

"Well, it's a two week rental, due to end when you would be returning from your senior class trip. She mentioned that she thought it would be a great way to spend some time with Megan before she heads off to college in the fall."

"Oh," Lisa said, letting the information sink in for a moment. She'd known that someone would most likely want to rent her life during the trip, but this was the first time she was directly confronting some of the important parts of her summer vacation she would miss. This would be her last vacation with Megan before college.... and other people would be living it. "Well, I guess that makes sense. I hope she has a lot of fun in Mexico then. So, how does this work?"

"It's pretty simple," the woman said, gesturing for Lisa to proceed into one of the small rooms off the hallway. "You'll need to change into the robe there, and we'll take your clothing over to Mrs. Rhodes. Then, lie down on the chair in the center of the room and relax. At that point, we do all the work to make sure you have all of the skills you'll need to live Mrs. Rhodes life for the next two weeks, and that people think you are her and vice versa. During the process, you'll be asleep. When you wake up, for the next two weeks, you will be Mrs. Rhodes, and she'll be Lisa Hale. After that, you get dressed in the clothing she wore here, drive off in her car, and spend the next two weeks being her while she vacations. There's a packet of information that we've compiled to help you live her life, just like the packet you helped us put together for her to live yours. Any questions?"

"You said I shouldn't talk to her about things... is there a reason?"

"For the most part, it's because it creates confusion. It brings the client out of their escape, and even while they are living your life, they have to 'be their real self again' to talk to you. It's a bit dissonant, and stressful, and if other people over hear the conversation, it can get very awkward. Our general advice is to keep your interactions minimal."

"Okay, that makes sense," Lisa said, neatly folding her clothes and settling down into the chair. "I guess I'm ready then."

Lisa thoughts were going everywhere as she didn't know what would happen. What would they do now? How long would it take to fix this?

"Lisa," the real Heather said with a small smile. It looked so strange to Lisa to see someone else speaking with her face, hearing her voice from someone else. "I'm glad you're okay. They were worried when you didn't wake up as quickly as I did, but I think that's just because I'm a deep sleeper."

"O. M. G." Lisa said, staring at Heather across the room as the other woman moved in Lisa's body. "It really is you isn't it Mrs. Rhodes?"

"It is," she said with a growing grin. "And Lisa, let me say how much it means to me that you were willing to let me rent your life in the first place. I feel like Megan and I have been growing apart lately, and I really wanted to spend the time with my little girl before she's gone. But I never thought this," she said, gesturing to Lisa's toned young body, "would happen to us."

"About that," Emma said, taking a seat in her office behind her large desk. "Why don't you both sit down and we can discuss this." Waiting for the two women to take a seat, Emma watched them closely as they moved. Already it was obvious that Heather was having an easier time in Lisa's body than Lisa was in Heather's... but that could simply be because a younger body was easier to adapt to... or because Heather had woken up nearly twenty minutes before Lisa had. Either way.... "First off, I'm glad you're both okay. We were very worried Lisa when you didn't wake up immediately and we're still looking into that, but for now, I'll take Heather's suggestion and run with it. There are several other details that we need to discuss though."

"You can fix this, right?" Lisa asked nervously.

"Well," Emma said after a deep breath. "I think so. But I don't know for sure. Like I said earlier, this has never happened before. We're going to need to take things slowly to make sure we don't cause more problems. Right now, I'd like to start with some very short term plans, and give the engineers and sorcerers some time to get things sorted out."

"What did you have in mind?" Heather asked, leaning back in her chair and crossing her legs. Every inch of her eighteen year old body shouted a maturity that Lisa didn't yet possess, from the relaxed posture to the tilt of her head. She radiated a confidence that had to be hard to feel, and was well beyond the years of Lisa's body.

"Well, for starters, I don't want to try doing anything with you two until the term of your rental is up. I understand that this is more of an exchange than you had signed up for, but in effect, you'll both have no difficulty fully living each other's lives for the next two weeks. If anything, Mrs Rhodes is going to enjoy an even more real vacation from her own life."

"But what about me?" Lisa asked, gesturing to Heather's enhanced body with her gleaming red nails. "I didn't sign up for... this. I mean... it's cool to be older and all Mrs. Rhodes, but.... what if I can't change back?"

"Lisa, I understand where you're coming from," Emma said gently. "But look at it this way. You're also getting an upgraded experience. And, since we understand that this is a bit more, um, intense than what you signed up for, The Nexus is willing to match Heather's rental fee, dollar for dollar while you're in her body."

"Well, I guess that's okay," Lisa said, still very unsure about where things were going. "And in two weeks, you'll be able to swap us back?"

"That's the idea," Emma said. "We'll need you to both take some tests today, and for the next two weeks, we'll be following up with each of you regularly. Once Heather is back from her vacation in Mexico, we'll work on getting you two swapped back. Who knows... if we can replicate this, you may be the first of our clients to offer a whole new level of service," she said on an excited note. "And believe me, we'd pay you for that, very well."

"Then it's settled," Heather said, bounding out of her chair in a spurt of youthful enthusiasm that she'd refrained from displaying thus far. "For the next two weeks, I'm Lisa, and you're my best friend's mom! You're the best," she finished, flinging her arms around her former body and giving Lisa a giant hug.

Slowly, Lisa melted into the hug, smiling a bit herself. The extra money was nice.... but honestly, she didn't care. Seeing how happy this was making her best friend's mom was worth it. After all, how often could you do something this amazing for someone? "It's settled. You have a good time now, you hear me young lady?"

"OMG," Heather said, imitating Lisa's manner from earlier. "I promise."

"Excellent," Emma said as she stood. "In that case, if you'll each follow me, I'll show you to the exam rooms where we have a few tests to run before you each go home."

After taking both women down the hall and deeper into the building, Emma dropped Lisa off in a room that looked much like the exam rooms at a doctor's office.

"Lisa, I mean, Mrs. Rhodes," Emma said, gesturing to the exam table in the room. "If you'll have a seat here, one of our staff will be with you shortly. I'll make sure they bring your clothes as well so you can get dressed."

"Thank you," Lisa said. Taking a seat on the table, she waited only a few moments after the door closed before getting off the table and standing before the full length mirror in the room. The reflection that gazed back at her was a familiar one, she'd seen Megan's mom plenty of times, but it was a completely different experience seeing it from this angle.

Standing before the mirror, she took a close look at her face. The makeup was superbly well done, applied with a light hand that covered the minor imperfections of her skin without trying to build an artificial layer on top of it. Her lips were lush and full and covered in a deep red lipstick that matched her manicured nails. "I'm glad they thinned out a bit after she got the injections last year," Lisa said, running her new tongue over the lush lips. "She looked like a pucker fish for days until the swelling went down."

Hearing Heather's voice when she spoke still felt very strange, but she was glad that Heather had never been a smoker. She could only imagine the kind of voice she'd have if she had been. But Heather took good care of herself. She might have had a little work done, but she hadn't been hard on her body. Her face was aging gracefully, and her tasteful makeup allowed the faintest of wrinkle lines at the corners of her eyes to show. The cute, pert nose was an improvement over the crooked nose that Mrs Rhodes had been born to, and the absence of the slight bump at the bridge of her nose seemed to open up her face and allow for a better look at her deep blue eyes. The roots of her bright blond hair showed a darker, dirty blond, but here to she could see that Heather had only enhanced what nature had given her. She was a natural blond, just not quite as vibrantly so. "I guess I'll need to touch up the dye job too... that will be something new."

"I imagine there are going to be several new things for you to experience for the next few weeks," a soft female voice said from the doorway. "You must be Lisa," the speaker continued as she stepped into the room. "My name is Cynthia," she finished extending a hand.

"I'm Lisa, but then, you knew that," Lisa said, looking over the woman.

Cynthia was shorter, and for a moment, Lisa wondered how anyone who was an adult could be that short until she remembered that Heather was 5'10" and that meant Cynthia was probably only an inch or two shorter than Lisa herself usually was. Cynthia wore her flame red hair in a short pixie cut that suited her diminutive stature and petite frame.

"I know you've already heard it, but we really are sorry about this. I've just got a few questions to ask you, mostly to figure out how extensively the transfer worked, and then I'll help you get dressed and on your way. To start, why don't you tell me your birthday, middle name, and the name of your favorite teacher in school."

"Oh, that's easy. I was born May 25th, my middle name is Elizabeth and my favorite teacher in school was Mr. Stein."

"Okay, good," Cynthia said making a few notes. "When is your electric bill due?"

"Usually around the 15th of the month," Lisa said automatically. "But I always pay it by the tenth, along with the cell phone and water bills. Wait... what?"

"Hmm... We were a little worried about that," Cynthia said looking over the sheet. "Remember, part of the program is to give you the skills you'd need to live the life of whoever is renting yours. If Heather had been a mechanic, you'd know how to fix cars. But Heather wasn't a mechanic. She's been a stay at home mom since college. At home, she does most of the cooking, the shopping, manages the finances, volunteers...."

"So, you're saying I got her skills? But, it was supposed to do that right? So this is a good thing isn't it?"

"Well, yes, and no. Remember, this is uncharted territory for us. In some ways, it would be simpler if it was a 100% pure transfer of minds. But now, some of her is tangled up in you, and you're tangled up in her body.... It means we're going to have to be very careful about putting you back into your own lives. We'll know more once we find out if Heather still knows how to do the things you know now how to do. Normally, you'd gain those skills only as long as the spells and enchantments are active and you'd lose them once you're back in your own life... but if she's lost them and you've gained them, that's something else new. We'll just have to see."

A few turns later and they entered a door with the name "Emma Nail, Director" scrawled in neat script on the frosted glass.

"I prefer gin," Lisa said automatically, then placed a hand over her mouth. "I mean, I'm not old enough to drink... where did that come from?"

After pouring a finger of scotch for herself, she took a seat on the other side of an impressive desk from Lisa and began to explain. "I need you to understand a few things before I get started. First, what happened today has never happened at The Nexus before, and we're still looking into why it happened, but for now, that's a question I can't answer. We're still sorting out all of the what that happened, but I think we have a much firmer grasp of that than we do the why. The second thing I need you to know is that we're here to help you, whatever that takes or whatever that means. Something went wrong, and it's our fault and we'll do whatever we can to make it right. Okay?"

"Now I'm scared," Lisa said, taking a sip of the gin and relaxing as the familiar flavor soothed ragged nerves. "What happened?"

"We can't tell for sure what started it, and I don't know if it would have happened with or without the procedure, but, in the middle of the process, Heather Rhodes went into cardiac arrest. She died very quickly, and without the reality of her life being connected to her body. Further, your life was not yet connected to her either. You are still eighteen years of age, still a friend and class mate of Megan Rhodes, and still the daughter of Robert and Elizabeth Hale. Lisa just barely made it to the bus stop when the bus arrived. Luckily Stacy got a bus pass with her and Lisa could step inside and take a seat. It made the situation tense between Stacy and her mom. Combined with the fact that her younger stepsister, Clarissa, never got out and was considered a mute by Stacy Lisa could understand why Stacy wanted some time away from her family.

Lisa barely noticed that she was already at the right bus stop and quickly pushed the stop button so she could leave. Lisa heard the driver saying something not very friendly but she was too far away to hear it right. Lisa then continued her walk to Stacy's home. She knew the streets a little, it was considered the poor district of town. When Lisa stopped in front of the house she got a little shock. It looked like it was abandoned. The chairs standing there were covered by grass, the mailbox had a dent in it and Lisa could smell the lingering odor of cigarettes being lit. This place was a mess. And she was supposed to stay here for now? Lisa got the urge to run away back to her old home, to her mom and dad. Looking down at herself she knew that wouldn't be possible. Going upstairs she could see the place was as run down as she thought. The walls were yellow because of the smoke and she could see some of the wallpaper letting loose. Lisa followed Tina down a hallway and flight of stairs until she ended up in a room with metallic looking walls. A translator soon came in and made things easier. The conversation was rather hurried since Maria (or rather Lisa in Maria's body) had to go back to her job soon. Maria explained that she had just started working at a factory close by. Since she had only just started it wouldn’t look out of place if the new Maria didn’t know the job very well. She had sat down with the nonprofit when they had first spoken of this program and they had a file they would hand to Lisa once the transfer was done with details on her new life.

Lisa felt bad that the paperwork she filled out didn’t go into much detail about her life, but she figured the new Lisa would have an easier time navigating things anyways. Maria thank her several more times in her thick accent and each time it made Lisa's stomach twirl. She was scared of all that she was about to lose, her whole life in fact, but she could tell how much this would mean for Maria.

Soon Maria was guided out of the room and Lisa was instructed to undress and sit in what looked like a dentist's chair as electrodes were attached to her. She was instructed to count down from ten.

One … two … three …
1351211.title: Maria looks the same as the picture on-file

13512111.content:
...the count continued, but Lisa fell asleep at about seven or eight.

She woke up disoriented, suddenly feeling the worst headache and nausea she had ever felt.
It felt about 10 times worse than any nausea she had experienced during her period.

She slowly opened her eyes, initially seeing blurry but her vision slowly coming back. Once she
could see normally, she inspected her surroundings, finding herself in an eerily similar room than
the one she had been in before the transfer.

She tried to slightly move her body facing the door when she suddenly felt a rush of new (and foreign)
feelings.

She then realized something she hadn't anticipated : unlike the temporary transfers, where one could
retain his/her original body, while appearing to the world as the other person, the nexus included a body
exchange in the permanent transfers. Lisa hadn't read the details of the operation, but it was clearly stated
in the nexus guidelines that, in order for the "new occupants" of said bodies to acclimate quicker and accept
those new bodies as their own, they would get not only the "outside reflection" of the donor, but his/her entire
body.

It was then that, in a second, Lisa realized that not only did she now look, to the outside world, like Maria Lopez,
but she had now BECOME Maria Lopez : body, curves, birthmarks, tatoos and all.

Wondering what else had been swapped (skills ? memories ?), the former Lisa started to panic, and quickly fainted
on her seat.

When she came back to her senses, she was greeted by...
13512111.title: Lisa's POV

choices: They swap bodies but not lives
The machine did not work but everybody other than Lisa and Maria thinks it did!
